Title: Super Typhoon Man-yi batters Philippines' most populous island
Description: Super Typhoon Man-yi slammed into the Philippines' most populous island on Sunday, with the national weather service warning of flooding, landslides and huge waves as the storm sweeps across the archipelago nation.

Title: Russian exiled opposition to stage major anti-war protest
Description: The Russian opposition, forced into exile and weakened by internal conflicts, will organize its first major demonstration against Moscow's Ukraine invasion in Berlin on Sunday, testing its political credibility in the third year of the war.

Title: World looks to G20 in Rio for breakthrough in climate talks
Description: Diplomatic tensions over global warming will take center stage at the G20 summit in Brazil this week, as negotiators at U.N. talks in Azerbaijan hit an impasse on climate finance that they hope leaders of the world's 20 major economies can break.

Title: Zelenskyy says Russia launched 120 missiles, 90 drones targeting ...
Description: Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest over the past months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.

Title: 8 killed in 2nd mass attack in China in a week
Description: A former student went on a stabbing rampage at a vocational college in eastern China, killing eight people and injuring 17, police said on Sunday, just days after the deadliest attack in the country in a decade.

Title: Japan's Mount Fuji eyes China-made tram to transport hikers, sour...
Description: Japanese authorities seeking to reduce the carbon footprint and overcrowding at Mount Fuji will propose a trackless, rubber- tired tram system made by China's CRRC to transport climbers, a person with direct knowledge of the plan said.

Title: Olympic champ Zheng, Hong Kong's Haughey on strength, sacrifice a...
Description: It is not often three Olympic gold medalists and Hong Kong's greatest athlete are gathered in a room together to discuss mental strength, sacrifice and what it takes to win, so when the opportunity arises you listen.

Title: Trump in New York for UFC fight at Madison Square Garden
Description: President-elect Donald Trump celebrated his election victory on Saturday night by attending an Ultimate Fighting Championship event with billionaire friend Elon Musk and cheering fans at a heavily guarded Madison Square Garden in New York City. Known by some in the mixed martial arts world as the 'Combatant in Chief,' Trump counts UFC President Dana White as a close friend and considers fans of the sport part of his political base. Trump sat between White and Musk and paid rapt attention to the fights.

Title: Trump taps fracking magnate and climate skeptic as energy chief
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump nominated fracking magnate and climate change skeptic Chris Wright as energy secretary on Saturday, tasking him with 'cutting red tape' which the new administration hopes will drive investment in fossil fuels.

Title: NK leader's sister says Seoul will have to pay 'dear price' for l...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said Sunday that South Korea will have to pay a 'dear price' for sending propaganda leaflets across the border the previous day.

Title: N. Korea's GPS jamming continues for 10th day
Description: North Korea's jamming of GPS signals across the border with South Korea continued Sunday for the 10th consecutive day, the military said.

Title: Xi vows to work with Trump team as he meets Biden in Peru
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Saturday vowed to work with the incoming U.S. administration of President-elect Donald Trump as he held his final talks with outgoing President Joe Biden on key conflicts from cyber crime to trade, Taiwan and Russia.

Title: NK troops in Ukraine war 'extremely significant' for east Asia se...
Description: Japan's foreign minister warned Saturday that North Korean troops entering the Ukraine conflict would have an 'extremely significant' effect on east Asian security.

Title: Fire engulfs hospital ward in northern India, killing 10 newborn ...
Description: A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said.

Title: Russia pumps gas via Ukraine but volumes to Austria cut
Description: Russian gas giant Gazprom continued to pump steady volumes of gas to Europe via Ukraine on Saturday, but supplies to Austrian energy company OMV were halted hours after Vienna said Russia had given notice it would cut off flows.

Title: APEC leaders hold Lima summit as Trump prepares to return to offi...
Description: Leaders of Pacific Rim countries including the U.S. and China gathered Friday in Peru for an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting, the first major global summit since U.S. President-elect Donald Trump’s election victory.

Title: Archegos' Bill Hwang deserves 21 years in prison, US says
Description: Bill Hwang, the founder of Archegos Capital Management, should spend 21 years in prison for running a market manipulation scheme that wiped out his $36 billion firm and cost its lenders more than $10 billion, federal prosecutors said on Friday.

Title: US to deter nuclear threats from N. Korea, China, Russia 'simulta...
Description: An updated U.S. nuclear employment strategy calls for the United States to be able to deter threats from North Korea, China and Russia 'simultaneously' during peacetime, a crisis and in conflict, a Pentagon report showed Friday.

Title: Trump names Karoline Leavitt as youngest ever White House press s...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump on Friday named Karoline Leavitt, his campaign press secretary, to serve as his White House press secretary.

Title: Poland moves to reopen embassy in N. Korea closed during COVID-19...
Description: Poland said Friday it is reactivating its embassy in North Korea’s capital to become the second Western nation after Sweden to resume operations that were suspended due to Pyongyang's tight COVID-19 restrictions.

Title: N. Korea's GPS jamming expands to wider regions along inter-Korea...
Description: North Korea appears to be jamming GPS signals in wider regions along its border with South Korea, a military official said Saturday, with the series of jamming believed to be linked to the North's own training against drones.

Title: US to deter nuclear threats from N. Korea, China, Russia 'simulta...
Description: An updated U.S. nuclear employment strategy calls for the United States to be able to deter threats from North Korea, China and Russia 'simultaneously' during peacetime, a crisis and in conflict, a Pentagon report showed Friday.

Title: China's October data shows soft economic underbelly, Trump threat...
Description: China's factory output growth slowed in October and it was still too early to call a turn in the crisis-hit property sector even though consumers perked up, keeping alive calls for Beijing to top-up its recent blitz of stimulus to revitalize the economy.

Title: US finalizes $6.6 billion chips award for TSMC ahead of Trump ret...
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said Friday it has finalized a $6.6 billion government subsidy for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing's U.S. unit for semiconductor production in Phoenix, Arizona.

Title: N. Korean leader 'sensitive' to int'l human rights pressure: ex-N...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is very 'sensitive' to international pressure over his country's human rights situation because he knows suppressing the issue is crucial to retaining his hereditary power, a former North Korean diplomat said Friday.

Title: US may have difficulty in proposing talks to NK amid enhanced thr...
Description: The United States may have difficulty in proposing dialogue to North Korea, given the North's advanced nuclear capabilities and security concerns raised by its troop deployment to Russia, a senior Seoul official said Friday.

Title: Ex-Trump envoy on N. Korea says Kim Jong-un won't negotiate denuc...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un won't negotiate denuclearization with the United States, as he has more powerful weapons and support from Russia, Joseph Yun, a former U.S. envoy on North Korea policy, said Friday, dismissing any chances for dialogue as a 'non-starter.'

Title: Trump team's 'America First' policy shouldn't mean 'America only'...
Description: Korean American Sen.-elect Andy Kim stressed the need Thursday to make sure that President-elect Donald Trump's 'America First' policy does not mean 'America only,' as he expressed concerns over some of Trump's personnel choices.

Title: Trump chooses anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as heal...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Thursday he will nominate anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to lead the Department of Health and Human Services, putting a man whose views public health officials have decried as dangerous in charge of a massive agency that oversees everything from drug, vaccine and food safety to medical research, Medicare and Medicaid.

Title: Fed will likely cut rates cautiously given persistent inflation p...
Description: Chair Jerome Powell said Thursday that the Federal Reserve will likely cut its key interest rate slowly and deliberately in the coming months, in part because inflation has shown signs of persistence and the Fed's officials want to see where it heads next.

Title: China's president unveils a megaport in Peru, but locals say they...
Description: On the edge of Peru’s coastal desert, a remote fishing town where a third of all residents have no running water is being transformed into a huge deep-water port to cash in on the inexorable rise of Chinese interest in resource-rich South America.

Title: Trump's transition team aims to kill Biden EV tax credit
Description: President-elect Donald Trump's transition team is planning to kill the $7,500 consumer tax credit for electric-vehicle purchases as part of broader tax-reform legislation, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Title: N. Korea's Kim orders mass production of suicide attack drones: K...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has overseen the performance test of suicide attack drones, and stressed the need for prompt full-scale mass production, the North's state media reported Friday.

Title: Will Trump revive his bromance with Kim Jong-un?
Description: As U.S. President-elect Donald Trump prepares for his second term, uncertainties loom over the Korean Peninsula, already fraught with North Korea's nuclear threats. South Koreans are increasingly anxious about the potential return of Trump’s unpredictable diplomatic approach.

Title: Two climate activists charged with spraying paint on UK's Stonehe...
Description: Two environmental protesters who sprayed paint on Britain's Stonehenge in June have been charged with offences related to the alleged damage caused to the prehistoric megalithic monument, prosecutors said on Thursday.

Title: Russia open to any Ukraine peace talks if Trump starts them: envo...
Description: Russia is open to negotiations on an end to the Ukraine war if initiated by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, but any talks need to be based on the realities of Russian advances, Moscow's ambassador to the U.N. in Geneva told reporters on Thursday.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'Don't die for Putin': Rights groups to send message ...
Description: Human rights groups in South Korea will issue a joint open letter urging North Korean troops deployed in Russia not to sacrifice their lives for Moscow’s war efforts against Ukraine, said an activist familiar with the matter.

Title: Donald Trump's China policy could pit deal makers against ideolog...
Description: Throughout his winning campaign, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump pitched himself as a master dealmaker, vowing to secure the best economic terms for America and insisting that doing so would restore its global supremacy.

Title: Trump officially taps Florida Sen. Marco Rubio as secretary of st...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump officially nominated Florida Sen. Marco Rubio as his secretary of state on Wednesday, calling him a 'strong advocate for our nation' and a 'true friend to our allies.'

Title: Trump names former congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard as director of nat...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump tapped former congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard to serve as the director of national intelligence (DNI) on Wednesday, saying the military veteran will bring 'fearless' spirit to America's intelligence community.

Title: Biden, Trump meet in White House, call for smooth transition
Description: President Joe Biden and President-elect Donald Trump met at the White House on Wednesday for the first time since last week's presidential election, with both calling for a smooth transition of power.

Title: Another Korean American wins seat in US Congress
Description: Another Korean American won a seat in the U.S. House of Representatives, a news report said Wednesday, an election that will add to a steadily growing list of Korean American lawmakers in Congress.

Title: China nominates vice UN representative as ambassador to S. Korea:...
Description: China's Deputy Permanent Representative to the United Nations Dai Bing has been nominated as the country's new ambassador to South Korea, diplomatic sources said Wednesday.

Title: Philippines says it will cooperate if ICC seeks Duterte's custody...
Description: The Philippine government said Wednesday its law enforcement agencies will be bound to cooperate if the International Criminal Court seeks the custody of former President Rodrigo Duterte as part of an investigation into thousands of deaths during his crackdown on illegal drugs.

Title: Delhi's pollution turns 'severe' as temperatures, wind speeds dro...
Description: Air pollution in India's national capital increased to 'severe' on an official index on Wednesday for the first time this season as temperatures and wind speeds dropped, reducing visibility and affecting some flights.

Title: China clears memorial to mass killing victims as government scram...
Description: Authorities in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai removed wreaths, candles and bottles of Chinese alcohol, offerings laid at the scene of the deadliest mass killing in the country in a decade, as the government scrambled to respond and censor the outrage online. On Monday, a male driver angry at his divorce settlement rammed his car into a crowd at a sports center in the city of 2.5 million, killing 35 people and injuring 43, but the government took almost a day to announce the death toll.

Title: Why are countries fighting over climate finance at COP29?
Description: The main task for nearly 200 countries at the U.N.'s COP29 climate summit is to broker a deal that ensures up to trillions of dollars in financing for climate projects worldwide.

Title: N. Korea deployment in Ukraine fight demands 'firm response': Bli...
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned Wednesday that the deployment of North Korean troops alongside Russian forces fighting on the Ukrainian border demanded a 'firm response.'

Title: Japan's rising wholesale inflation heightens uncertainty on BOJ's...
Description: Japan's wholesale inflation accelerated in October at the fastest annual pace in more than a year as renewed yen falls pushed up import costs for some goods, complicating the central bank's decision on how soon to raise interest rates.

Title: Trump's Rubio and Waltz picks signal 'existential' fight with Chi...
Description: In leaning on hawks Marco Rubio and Mike Waltz, Donald Trump is setting the stage for an existential battle against China - although, as always, the president-elect's knack for dealmaking may intervene.

Title: Trump picks John Ratcliffe to be CIA director
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Tuesday he had picked former Director of National Intelligence (DNI) John Ratcliffe to serve as director of the Central Intelligence Agency.

Title: Trump taps Fox News host Pete Hegseth as defense secretary
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated military veteran and Fox News host Pete Hegseth to serve as defense secretary when the Republican takes back the White House in January.

Title: Trump says Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy will lead Dept. of Governme...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Tuesday Elon Musk and former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency.

Title: Trump officially names Rep. Mike Waltz as his national security a...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump officially named Florida Rep. Mike Waltz as his national security advisor on Tuesday, saying the Green Beret veteran will be a 'tremendous' champion of his incoming administration's pursuit of 'peace through strength.'

Title: US confirms N. Korean troops have begun engaging in combat operat...
Description: The United States confirmed Tuesday that North Korean troops, who have been deployed to Russia's western front-line Kursk region, have begun engaging in combat operations against Ukrainian forces.

Title: Trump's Day One: Deportations, border wall, scrapping Biden human...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to take a slew of executive actions on his first day in the White House to ramp up immigration enforcement and roll back President Joe Biden’s flagship legal entry programs, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Title: Britain's Queen Camilla returns to public duties after chest infe...
Description: Britain’s Queen Camilla is set to return to public duties Tuesday after missing weekend events commemorating the nation’s war dead because she was recovering from a chest infection.

Title: Awareness of human rights growing inside N. Korea thanks to int'l...
Description: International attention to North Korea's human rights abuses has had a perceptible effect in raising awareness of human rights among the country's general public, a former North Korean diplomat said Tuesday, calling for sustained global efforts on the issue.

Title: Kim Jong-un sees UN criticism of Pyongyang's human rights situati...
Description: According to documents obtained by the Ministry of Unification, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was broadly involved in directing the country's response to international criticism of its human rights situation, viewing it as a threat to his regime.

Title: Japan PM Ishiba survives parliament vote as Trump looms large
Description: Japanese lawmakers voted for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to stay on as leader on Monday, after his scandal-tarnished coalition lost its parliamentary majority in a lower house election last month.

Title: Trump likely to appoint US Senator Marco Rubio as top US diplomat...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is expected to appoint U.S. Senator Marco Rubio as his first secretary of state under his second term, news reports have said.

Title: Taiwan says no new 'stage of talks' with US on arms sales
Description: There is no new 'stage of talks' with the United States at the moment for arms sales, Taiwan's government said on Monday, as the island considers how best to respond to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's previous demands that Taipei pay for protection.

Title: The fight for AI talent heats up in China, as tech employers boos...
Description: A scramble for artificial intelligence (AI) talent is intensifying in China, as local tech giants dangle eye-watering salaries to hire top-notch professionals to compete in a heated AI race.

Title: Tesla stock extends rally as Musk-Trump alliance fuels gains
Description: Tesla shares extended last week's sharp rally with a jump of over 8 percent on Monday, fueled by bets of the automaker benefiting from CEO Elon Musk's close ties with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump.

Title: Trump taps Stefanik to be UN Ambassador
Description: Donald Trump has chosen Republican Representative Elise Stefanik to serve as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, the president-elect said in a statement shared with Reuters on Monday.

Title: Saudi-hosted summit says Mideast peace requires end to Israeli oc...
Description: Arab and Muslim leaders demanded on Monday that Israel withdraw from occupied Palestinian territories as a precondition for regional peace, while denouncing 'shocking' Israeli crimes in war-ravaged Gaza.

Title: Trump picks Florida Rep. Mike Waltz as national security adviser:...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has picked Florida Rep. Mike Waltz as his national security adviser, according to a news report, as he is in the process of picking key officials for his incoming administration amid multiple policy challenges, including North Korea's nuclear threats and Russia's war in Ukraine.

Title: N. Korea's Kim finalizes defense pact with Russia
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has signed off a defense pact with Russia, the North's state media reported Tuesday, amid heightened concerns over Pyongyang's troop dispatch to Russia.

Title: Source says Trump told Putin not to escalate in Ukraine, Kremlin ...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin and advised him not to escalate the Ukraine war, a source familiar with the conversation said, but the Kremlin denied the two had spoken.

Title: Paris agreement climate goals 'in great peril', warns UN
Description: The Paris climate agreement's goals 'are in great peril' and 2024 is on track to break new temperature records, the United Nations warned Monday as COP29 talks opened in Baku.

Title: Defectors' group delivers leaflets encouraging defection among N....
Description: A group of North Korean defectors delivered propaganda leaflets to Ukraine on Monday, encouraging North Korean soldiers deployed in Russia to defect, as thousands of North Korean troops have been sent to support Russia's war against Ukraine.

Title: Japan PM Ishiba survives parliament vote as Trump looms large
Description: Japanese lawmakers voted for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to stay on as leader on Monday, after his scandal-tarnished coalition lost its parliamentary majority in a lower house election last month.

Title: Did Russia provide ICBM technology to North Korea?
Description: Speculation is growing that Russia may have provided North Korea with military technology to advance its intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) program, given that the latest launch in October was conducted without a new engine test, according to analysts, Monday.

Title: Head of key Japan opposition party admits to extra-marital affair
Description: Yuichiro Tamaki, the head of the Japanese opposition party that has emerged as kingmaker as lawmakers select the next prime minister on Monday, said a tabloid report about his extra-marital affair with a model was 'basically true.'

Title: Satellite images and documents indicate China working on nuclear ...
Description: China has built a land-based prototype nuclear reactor for a large surface warship, in the clearest sign yet Beijing is advancing toward producing its first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, according to a new analysis of satellite imagery and Chinese government documents provided to The Associated Press.

Title: Trump announces Tom Homan, former director of immigration enforce...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump says that Tom Homan, his former acting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) director, will serve as 'border czar' in his incoming administration.

Title: Trump speaks to Putin, warns against escalating in Ukraine: repor...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has spoken to Russian President Vladimir Putin and urged him not to escalate the war in Ukraine, the Washington Post reported Sunday.

Title: N. Korea's Hwasong-19 ICBM launch did not involve new engine test...
Description: North Korea's recent launch of the Hwasong-19 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) is believed to have taken place without a new engine test, a South Korean lawmaker said Monday, amid suspicions that Russia may have provided technical assistance to the North for the missile firing.

Description: Ukraine's defense intelligence agency has released an audio clip of what it claims to be intercepted radio communications between North Korean soldiers in Russia speaking in coded military terms.

Title: Putin finalizes N. Korea defense deal
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed off on a landmark defense pact with North Korea, a deal that comes amid reports that Pyongyang has despatched thousands of troops to fight against Ukraine.

Title: Ukraine attacks Moscow with 34 drones, biggest strike on Russian ...
Description: Ukraine attacked Moscow on Sunday with at least 34 drones, the biggest drone strike on the Russian capital since the start of the war in 2022, forcing flights to be diverted from three of the city's major airports and injuring at least one person.

Title: China, Indonesia seal $10 bil. in deals focused on green energy, ...
Description: China and Indonesia signed deals worth $10 billion at the Indonesia-China Business Forum in Beijing on Sunday, spanning sectors including food, new energy, technology, and biotechnology, Chinese state media reported.

Title: N. Korea blamed for 331 GPS disruptions this month: science minis...
Description: North Korea was identified as the source of 331 cases of GPS disruptions reported this month, the science ministry said Sunday, noting that no major issues or damage occurred.

Title: China searches for safe havens amid US debt woes, dollar weaponiz...
Description: Ever since the U.S. dollar cemented its role as the backbone of the global financial system following the second world war, it has been a weapon of choice for American presidents waging economic warfare.

Title: US ordered TSMC to halt shipments to China of chips used in AI ap...
Description: The U.S. ordered Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing to halt shipments of advanced chips to Chinese customers that are often used in artificial intelligence applications starting Monday, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Title: Biden, Trump to meet at the White House on Wednesday
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden and President-elect Donald Trump will meet on Wednesday at the White House on Biden's invitation, a White House spokesperson said on Saturday.

Title: Qatar suspends its mediation efforts on Gaza

Title: Iran urges Trump to change 'maximum pressure' policy
Description: Iran on Saturday urged U.S. President-elect Donald Trump to reconsider the 'maximum pressure' policy he pursued against Tehran during his first term.

Title: Dutch government investigating possible missed warnings from Isra...
Description: The Dutch government is investigating if possible warning signs from Israel were missed in the events leading up to this week's assaults on Israeli soccer fans, Justice Minister David van Weel said in a letter to Parliament.

Title: Germany marks 1989 Berlin Wall fall with 'Preserve Freedom' party
Description: Germany marks 35 years since the Berlin Wall fell with festivities from Saturday under the theme 'Preserve Freedom!' as Russia's war rages in Ukraine and many fear democracy is under attack.

Title: China summons Philippine ambassador over 'new maritime laws'
Description: China summoned the Philippines' ambassador Friday to express its objection to two new laws in the Southeast Asian nation asserting maritime rights and sovereignty over disputed areas of the South China Sea, its foreign ministry said.

Title: Trump has not asked Lighthizer to reprise US trade chief post: so...
Description: Former U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer has not been asked by President-elect Donald Trump to return to the agency overseeing trade policy in his new administration, contrary to a Financial Times report, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Title: N. Korea jams GPS signals, affecting ships, civilian aircraft: JC...
Description: North Korea staged GPS jamming attacks for the second consecutive day Saturday, affecting several ships and dozens of civilian aircraft, South Korea's military said.

Title: Trump put Elon Musk on phone with Ukraine's Zelenskyy during cong...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump put billionaire Elon Musk on the line with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy when the Ukrainian leader called to congratulate the incoming U.S. president, according to a Ukrainian official with direct knowledge of the phone call.

Title: Over 3,700 N. Koreans visited Russia in Q3 for 'studies': RFA
Description: More than 3,700 North Koreans visited Russia during the third quarter this year for 'study' purposes, marking the highest quarterly figure since 2010, a United States news outlet reported Saturday.

Title: Koreans in US both anxious, optimistic over Trump's return
Description: SEATTLE - After one of the most unpredictable elections in the U.S. came to an end Tuesday (local time), Koreans across the country woke up to news that Donald Trump has clinched a stunning comeback to become U.S. president once again.

Title: Biden vows peaceful White House handover, Trump eyes Putin talks
Description: Joe Biden pledged a peaceful transfer of power Thursday after Donald Trump's decisive U.S. election win, while the Republican showed his intent to ditch the outgoing president's policies by suggesting he would talk to Vladimir Putin.

Title: Alibaba Cloud notches big with 'China's Instagram' completing lar...
Description: Alibaba Group Holding's cloud computing arm is now home to 500,000 terabytes worth of data from Chinese lifestyle platform Xiaohongshu after what the companies called the largest data migration ever, a case that could enhance the leading position of one of the country's largest tech firms in the domestic cloud market.

Title: Most of Wall Street rises after Fed cuts interest rates
Description: Most U.S. stocks rose Thursday, as the Federal Reserve cut interest rates again to make things easier for the economy.

Title: NATO warns of NK threat in pitch to Trump on Ukraine
Description: NATO chief Mark Rutte said Thursday that North Korea's involvement in Russia's war against Ukraine posed a direct threat to the United States, in a first effort to convince Donald Trump to keep backing Kyiv.

Title: Putin notes possibility of joint military exercises between N. Ko...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday mentioned the possibility of Russia and North Korea holding joint military exercises, TASS reported, amid growing concerns about deepening military cooperation between the two countries.

Title: President-elect Trump names Susie Wiles as chief of staff, first ...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump has named Susie Wiles, the defacto manager of his victorious campaign, as his White House chief of staff, the first woman to hold the influential role.

Title: US Fed cuts interest rates quarter point after Trump victory
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve shrugged off concerns about the impact of Donald Trump's election victory on interest rates and moved ahead with a quarter point cut Thursday.

Title: Macron warns Europe must not 'delegate forever' its security to U...
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron told a European leaders' gathering Thursday that the continent must assert its security independence from the United States - and defend its 'interests' over those of geopolitical rivals.

Title: Europe urges Trump to support Ukraine, avoid trade wars
Description: European leaders meeting in Budapest on Thursday urged Donald Trump from afar to avoid trade wars, maintain support for Ukraine and to refrain from unsettling the global order following his victory in the U.S. presidential election.

Title: US firms at China trade fair upbeat on Trump future
Description: American businesses at a major Shanghai trade fair said Thursday they were optimistic about U.S.-China commerce under a second Donald Trump presidency, despite his tough rhetoric on tariffs raising fears of a new trade war.

Title: With Trump win, India open to freeing up market access for US fir...
Description: India is open to offering easier market access for U.S. firms if Washington reciprocates under President-elect Donald Trump, who has long called out New Delhi for its high tariffs, sources aware of the matter said.

Title: Vatican hopes for 'wisdom' from Trump
Description: The Vatican's secretary of state congratulated U.S. president-elect Donald Trump, Thursday, while expressing doubt that the Republican had a 'magic wand' to end conflicts quickly as promised during the campaign.

Title: Blood money': Defectors liken N. Korean soldiers in Russia to wa...
Description: North Korean defectors in South Korea, who closely follow reports of the North's soldiers joining Russian forces in Ukraine, have raised doubts about their combat readiness.

Title: US and China must 'get along', Xi tells Trump
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said Thursday Beijing and Washington must find a way to 'get along' in a message to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, state media reported.

Title: Trump victory heightens risks for BOJ as yen renews slide

Title: N. Korea silent on Trump's presidential victory
Description: North Korea's state media on Thursday remained silent about former U.S. President Donald Trump's election victory to secure a second presidential term.

Title: China braces for fresh tensions with Trump over trade, tech and T...
Description: The first time China faced Donald Trump in the White House, there was a trade war, a breach of protocol involving Taiwan’s former leader, and a president-to-president bromance that turned sour.

Title: Trump's return to power fueled by Hispanic, working-class voter s...
Description: Donald Trump reshaped the U.S. electorate once again this year, piling up support among Hispanic voters, young people, and Americans without college degrees - and winning more votes in nearly all of the country as he reclaimed the presidency.

Title: NK troops engaged in combat in Kursk for 1st time: US officials
Description: North Korean troops were engaged in combat in Russia's Kursk in recent days for the first time, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Wednesday.

Title: Stocks surge to record highs as Trump returns to presidency
Description: U.S. stocks rallied sharply to close at record highs on Wednesday after Republican Donald Trump won the 2024 U.S. presidential election in a stunning comeback four years after being voted out of the White House.

Title: Kamala Harris concedes election but vows to fight on
Description: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris delivered a televised concession speech to the nation on Wednesday after a whirlwind campaign that failed to stop Republican Donald Trump's return to the White House.

Title: Trump victory to test limits of US presidential power

Title: Why Kamala Harris lost 2024 election to Donald Trump
Description: In a meeting with one of America’s most powerful unions in September at its Washington headquarters, Vice President Kamala Harris said she’d protect union jobs and workers’ livelihoods better than Donald Trump.

Title: Trump may resume direct diplomacy with North Korea: experts
Description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump is returning to the White House, leaving analysts to speculate whether he will resume direct diplomacy with North Korea as part of his second-term agenda.

Title: What impact will Trump have on global economy?

Title: Voter anxiety over economy, desire for change returns Trump to Wh...
Description: A disaffected electorate wanted former President Donald Trump to return to the White House, a blatant rejection of Vice President Kamala Harris and her nearly four years with President Joe Biden.

Title: China will work with US on basis of mutual respect, foreign minis...
Description: China will continue to work with the United States on the basis of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation, a foreign ministry spokesperson said on Wednesday, after Donald Trump claimed victory in the U.S. presidential election.

Title: North Korea to face scrutiny at UN human rights review

Title: South Korea vows not to repatriate North Koreans against will
Description: South Korea has vowed not to repatriate people to North Korea against their will as it did in 2019 with two North Korean fishermen, according to the National Human Rights Commission of Korea (NHRCK) on Wednesday.

Title: Trump wins Georgia, North Carolina, leads in other swing states a...
Description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has won Georgia and North Carolina and is leading in five other battleground states in Tuesday's election showdown against his Democratic rival Kamala Harris, while his party regained control of the Senate.

Title: N. Korea may seek diplomatic ties with US if Trump reelected: ex-...
Description: A former North Korean diplomat who defected to South Korea said Wednesday Pyongyang may seek to establish diplomatic ties with Washington and seek partial sanctions removal if former U.S. President Donald Trump is reelected to the White House.

Title: Elon Musk sued over $1 million election giveaway
Description: Elon Musk was sued in a proposed class action on Tuesday by registered voters who signed his petition to support the Constitution for a chance to win his $1 million-a-day giveaway, and now claim it was a fraud.

Title: Marijuana legalization fails in Florida as numerous states approv...
Description: A costly campaign to legalize recreational marijuana in Florida failed Tuesday as voters in dozens of states weighed more than 140 measures appearing on the ballot alongside races for president and top state offices.

Title: Israel's Netanyahu fires defense minister over 'trust' breakdown
Description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired his defense minister Tuesday after public differences over the war in Gaza, replacing him with the country's former top diplomat.

Title: Andy Kim wins Senate race, becomes 1st Korean American senator
Description: Andy Kim, a third-term congressman, won a Senate seat for New Jersey in the U.S. general election Tuesday, the Associated Press reported, making history as the first Korean American elected to the upper chamber of Congress.

Title: Hoax bomb threats linked to Russia target polling places in battl...
Description: Hoax bomb threats, many of which appeared to originate from Russian email domains, were directed on Tuesday at polling locations in four battleground states - Georgia, Michigan, Arizona and Wisconsin - as Election Day voting was underway, the FBI said.

Title: Top diplomats of G7 countries decry N. Korea's recent ICBM launch...
Description: The top diplomats of the Group of Seven (G7) countries condemned North Korea's recent intercontinental ballistic missile launch in the 'strongest terms' on Tuesday, reiterating their call for the 'complete' denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.

Title: Polls in swing states begin to close as sharply divided America c...
Description: A divided America weighed a stark choice for the nation’s future Tuesday as a presidential campaign marked by upheaval and rancor approached its finale.

Title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy confirms first combat with N. Korean troops
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has confirmed the Ukrainian military's first combat engagement with North Korean troops, saying it opened a new chapter of instability in the world.

Title: Trump vs Harris: US voters head to polls as turbulent campaign co...
Description: The dizzying presidential contest between Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Kamala Harris hurtled toward an uncertain finish on Tuesday as millions of Americans headed to the polls to choose between two sharply different visions for the country.

Title: North Korean troops in Russia are shelled by Ukrainian forces, a ...
Description: North Korean troops recently deployed to help Russia in its war with Ukraine have come under Ukrainian fire, a Kyiv official said Tuesday.

Title: Russia says NK's missile tests were 'legitimate' defensive measur...
Description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko said Tuesday that North Korea's missile tests were 'legitimate' defensive measures in response to what he described as the United States' 'provocations,' Russia's state-run news agency reported.

Title: Harris, Trump set sights on Pennsylvania in final push before Ele...
Description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump closed out this year’s presidential race with a fierce battle for Pennsylvania on Monday, making their final pitch to voters across a state that could prove decisive in the campaign for the White House.

Title: North Korea displays military might ahead of US presidential elec...
Description: North Korea fired multiple short-range ballistic missiles toward the East Sea, Tuesday, in what appears to be an attempt to assert its presence just before the U.S. presidential election, according to analysts, Tuesday.

Title: AI-created video featuring 3 S. Korean missionaries detained in N...
Description: An artificial intelligence-created video featuring three South Korean Christian missionaries who have been detained in North Korea for 10 years will air this month as part of a campaign to address issues related to detainees, the unification ministry said Tuesday.

Title: Trump warns, if elected, he'll impose tariffs on Mexico, China ov...
Description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump warned on Monday that, if elected, he would punish Mexico and China with tariffs unless both governments moved to stop the flow of fentanyl into the United States.

Title: Americans start casting ballots to pick new president after event...
Description: American voters began going to the polls Tuesday to pick a new president who will steer the United States through a litany of nettlesome issues, including deep national division, still-high prices and global security challenges, like North Korea's nuclear adventurism and Russia's war in Ukraine.

Title: Considerable' number of some 10,000 NK troops in Russia moved to...
Description: Some 10,000 North Korean troops have been deployed in Russia, with a 'considerable' number of them having been dispatched to front-line areas, South Korea's defense ministry said Tuesday.

Title: Wrong claims by Musk on US election got 2 billion views on X in 2...
Description: False or misleading claims by billionaire Elon Musk about the U.S. election have amassed 2 billion views on social media platform X this year, according to a report by non-profit group Center for Countering Digital Hate.

Title: China's population woes deepen as marriage registrations tumble
Description: China is on track to post its lowest number of marriage registrations since 1980 this year, with an estimate from a leading demographer suggesting as few as 6 million couples would tie the knot, prompting local governments to hand out cash incentives.

Title: N. Korean leader urges completion of flood rehabilitation before ...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has inspected flood-hit areas and called for expediting rehabilitation to ensure its completion before a plenary meeting of the ruling Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) in December, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: Pennsylvania judge allows Elon Musk's $1 million voter giveaway
Description: A Pennsylvania state judge on Monday allowed Elon Musk’s $1 million-a-day giveaway to swing state voters to proceed, after a surprising day of testimony in which the billionaire's aide acknowledged his political group selected the contest's winners.

Title: NK leader's sister says S. Korea-US-Japan air drills justify Nort...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un lambasted the recent joint air drills staged by South Korea, the United States and Japan, claiming they validate her country's policy of bolstering its nuclear forces, the North's state media said Tuesday.

Title: US gives Israel 'fail' grade on improving aid to Gaza so far
Description: The Biden administration is stepping up criticism of Israel for not doing enough to improve humanitarian conditions in Gaza as a 30-day deadline looms for Israeli officials to meet certain requirements or risk potential restrictions on military assistance.

Title: As many as 10,000 N. Korean troops are in Kursk, could join comba...
Description: As many as 10,000 North Korean troops are in Russia's western front-line Kursk region and could engage in combat in the 'coming days,' a State Department spokesperson said Monday, amid growing concerns that their involvement could expand Moscow's war in Ukraine.

Title: Harris, Trump make final appeals to voters on Election Day eve am...
Description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her Republican rival Donald Trump made their final pitch to court undecided voters on Monday, a day before the high-stakes general election that could reshape America's policy on its alliances, the economy, trade and other key issues.

Title: Putin meets N. Korean FM Choe: TASS
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has met North Korean Foreign Minister Choe Son-hui at the Kremlin in Moscow, TASS reported, amid growing concerns over Pyongyang's troop deployment to Russia to support its war in Ukraine.

Title: N. Korea fires ballistic missile toward East Sea just ahead of US...
Description: North Korea fired an unidentified ballistic missile toward the East Sea on Tuesday, South Korea's military said, just ahead of the U.S. presidential election.

Title: S. Korean delegation to Ukraine returns home after discussion on ...
Description: A South Korean government delegation to Ukraine returned home Monday after visiting Kyiv to discuss possible cooperation measures in response to North Korea's troop deployment to Russia, officials said.

Title: Japan successfully launches defense satellite carried by new flag...
Description: Japan launched a defense satellite aimed at speedier communication and military operations on a new flagship H3 rocket on Monday and successfully placed it into orbit, as the country seeks to build up its military capability amid growing tension in the region.

Title: 1st N. Korean troops come under Ukrainian attack in Kursk: Ukrain...
Description: The first batch of North Korean troops dispatched to Russia to fight in its war against Ukraine has likely already come under Ukrainian attack in the western Russian border region of Kursk, a Ukrainian official said Monday.

Title: N. Korea raises earthen hills to block severed inter-Korean roads...
Description: North Korea has raised 11-meter-high earthen hills to completely block inter-Korean roads that it blew up last month, South Korea's military said Monday, in yet another show of Pyongyang's efforts to sever ties with the South.

Title: Spain flood survivors hurl mud at royals, top government official...
Description: A crowd of enraged survivors hurled clots of mud left by storm-spawned flooding at the Spanish royal couple on Sunday during their first visit to the center of their nation's deadliest natural disaster in living memory.

Title: Alibaba cuts 'dozens of employees' at metaverse unit as hype in s...
Description: Alibaba Group Holding is scaling down its metaverse operations, according to a source familiar with the matter, making it the latest Big Tech company to pull back resources from the once-popular sector.

Title: N. Korea presumed to change name of think tank dealing with affai...
Description: North Korea appears to have changed the name of a think tank designed to analyze affairs with South Korea, Seoul's unification ministry said Monday, as its leader Kim Jong-un has bolstered animosity toward the South.

Title: Trump rhetoric darkens, Harris vows Gaza peace in final hours
Description: Kamala Harris courted voters angered by the Gaza war while Donald Trump doubled down on violent rhetoric with a comment about journalists being shot as the tense U.S. election campaign headed into its final hours.

Title: Moldova's pro-Western Sandu claims election win after meddling al...
Description: Moldova's pro-Western incumbent Maia Sandu claimed victory at Sunday's closely-fought presidential election, defeating Alexandr Stoianoglo, her rival backed by the traditionally pro-Russian Socialist Party.

Title: US Fed to debate rate cut in shadow of presidential election
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is widely expected to cut interest rates again this week, while votes are being counted in one of the closest-fought presidential races in decades.

Title: Israel says it carried out ground raid into Syria, seizing Syrian...
Description: The Israeli military said Sunday it has carried out a ground raid into Syria, seizing a Syrian citizen involved in Iranian networks. It was the first time in the current war that Israel announced its troops operated in Syrian territory.

Title: Experts discuss how to financially prepare for unified Korea
Description: Scholars and experts in inter-Korea relations and finance assessed the economic situation of the two Koreas and discussed how to prepare for a unified Korea in light of the rapidly evolving international landscape, during a seminar, Friday.

Title: Expectations high for possible election of 1st Korean American se...
Description: With the U.S. general election two days away, expectations remained high Sunday for high-profile Korean American politicians, including a congressman who has led a formidable campaign to become the first Korean American to join the Senate.

Title: Harris, Trump gird for Tuesday's election showdown; polls show th...
Description: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her Republican rival Donald Trump are bracing for this week's high-stakes election showdown, with various polls showing them in a tight margin-of-error race.

Title: US election cycle marked by tumults, uncertainties, sharp candida...
Description: This year's U.S. election cycle has been marked by a string of unprecedented events from two assassination attempts against former President Donald Trump to President Joe Biden's surprise exit from the White House race and the Republican candidate's conviction in a 'hush-money' trial.

Title: Moldova in tense vote for EU future
Description: Moldovans went to the polls on Sunday in a tense presidential election runoff that could play a key role in the country's European future amid fears of Russian interference.

Title: Israel army issues new evacuation call for Lebanon's Baalbek regi...
Description: The Israeli military on Sunday called for the evacuation of the Baalbek area in eastern Lebanon, warning that it was ready to strike Hezbollah targets there and in nearby Douris.

Title: IMF to begin review Egypt's loan program on Tuesday
Description: The International Monetary Fund will begin its review of Egypt's loan programme on Tuesday, Egyptian Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly said on Sunday at a press conference with IMF managing director Kristalina Georgieva.

Title: Zelensky says Ukraine struck by 900 bombs in the space of one wee...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenksyy has called on foreign allies for more help with air defence after another week of what he said were more than 900 bombings.

Title: Federal Reserve is set to cut rates again while facing a hazy pos...
Description: No one knows how Tuesday's presidential election will turn out, but the Federal Reserve's move two days later is much easier to predict: With inflation continuing to cool , the Fed is set to cut interest rates for a second time this year.

Title: Harris campaigns in Michigan, Trump hits eastern battleground sta...
Description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris campaigns in Michigan on Sunday while her Republican rival Donald Trump will stop in three eastern battleground states in the final days of an election that could be decided by a small slice of American voters.

Title: Over 7,000 N. Korean troops deployed near border with Ukraine, ar...
Description: Kyiv's defense intelligence agency has said Russia appears to have deployed more than 7,000 North Korean soldiers, armed with AK-12 rifles, mortar rounds and other assault weapons, to areas near the border with Ukraine.
